column1: Culumalda was a tree with hanging yellow blossoms that grew in Ithilien
column2: and especially in the woods around the Field of Cormallen.
column3: pp. 625-6 (citing from the Unfinished index) (entry for mal-)

column1: Culumalda was intended to be the source of the name Cormallen#Etymology.
Christopher Tolkien connects culumalda to the Elvish stems KUL ("golden-red") and mal- ("gold").
Helge Fauskanger has suggested that culumalda is Quenya
column3: "http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/quen-eng.rtf Quenya-English Wordlist (Quettaparma Quenyanna)" at http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/ Ardalambion (accessed 2 July 2011)

column1: J.R.R. Tolkien indicated that the tree was "probably a Wikipedia:laburnum".
